ship.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a large boat used for carrying people or goods across the sea
ship.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: a ship that carries people rather than goods
a large ship that people have holidays on
a large ship that sails long distances across the ocean
a ship that makes short regular journeys between two places
The ferry operates daily between Hull and Zeebrugge.
a ship that carries goods rather than people
a ship that carries goods in special containers which can be put on trucks
a large ship that carries goods
a very large ship that carries oil
a ship that carries goods on a river or canal
a military ship with guns, used in a war
the largest type of ship used in war, with very big guns on it
a military ship that planes can fly from or land on
a small fast military ship with guns, often used for protecting battleships
a small fast ship with guns on it, often used in shallow water near a coast
a military ship that can stay under water
a military ship used for removing bombs from under water
ship.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to send goods somewhere by ship, plane, truck etc
ship.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: A new engine was shipped over from the US.
ship.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to make a piece of computer equipment or software available for people to buy
ship.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: They’re now shipping their long-awaited new anti-virus software.
Both products are due to ship at the beginning of June.
ship.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to order someone to go somewhere
ship.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: He was shipped off to a juvenile detention center.
ship.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a particular position or job, or the time during which you have it
ship.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: He was offered a professorship  (=the job of professor).
in Mr Major’s premiership  (=when he was prime minister)
ship.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Private car ownership has almost doubled in the past ten years.
ship.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: all the people in a particular group
ship.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: a magazine with a readership of 9,000 (=with 9,000 readers)
ship.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: Safe Home Income Plans association; an official organization in Britain that represents and controls companies who provide Hips
ship.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: a large boat used for carrying people or goods across the sea
ship.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: The island’s waste is taken by ship to the mainland.
ship.translation[5].definitions[0].defin: to send or carry something by ship
ship.translation[5].definitions[0].examp: I had my car shipped out to me.
ship.translation[5].definitions[1].defin: to send or deliver something by road, train, or air
ship.translation[5].definitions[1].examp: A new computer was shipped to him within two weeks.
ship.translation[5].definitions[2].defin: to make goods, especially computer software, available for people to buy or use
ship.translation[5].definitions[2].examp: The software giant declined to release the number of units its subsidiary has shipped.
